page.title: 09King's School - Buildings.
page.content: The oldest part of {King's School}is that which occupies Old House; this is largely 16th century. In 1872, New House was built as a Headmaster's House and dining hall. Priory House was purchased in 1942, and in 1954, Lyon House was opened on the site of the original sanitorium. Blackford House was built in 1960, and in 1984, Wellesley House was acquired for the girls. The Memorial Hall was opened at the start of the century and incorporates four classrooms, the Norton Library and the assembly hall. In the 1970's, a new dining hall, and Art and Geography Schools were built, as was a new house for the Headmaster. A Sports Hall and Theatre complex were opened by the Bishop of London on 20 November 1979, and in 1983, a Craft Centre was opened in the old Board School.
